title: What is a good example of a barrier used with quantum tunneling? - Quora

response.answer_text:
Without quibbling over what would make an example good, my favorite examples of real life tunneling are: Esaki diodes Here the barrier is a thin depletion layer in a semi-conductor  The result is under certain voltage bias current can flow as electrons tunnel across the depletion layer.  Page on sc.edu
Radioactive decay Page on colorado.edu   In this case Heisenberg Uncertainty results in the probability of particles in the energy well of an atom finding themselves outside the energy well with the result that the atom disintegrates.
